brief_summary.textblock:
Minilaparatomy cholecystectomy with ultrasonic dissection (UsD) is rarely considered and
      therefore we investigate here the contributions of UsD in early recovery.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy Versus Ultrasonic Dissection Assisted Minilaparotomy Cholecystectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:- Uncomplicted symptomatic cholelithiasis cholecystitis confirmed by
        ultrasoud

          -  ASA physical status 1-3

          -  Body mass index 18-30

          -  AGE 18 - 75 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnancy or lactating

          -  common bile-duct stones

          -  acute cholecystitis

          -  previous upper abdominal operation

          -  Chirrosis

          -  Renal disease

          -  Pancreatitis

          -  ASA 4-5

          -  Participation of any other clinical trial within 30 days before the start of the
             screening period

          -  History of uncontrolled cardiovascular, epileptic disorder, psychosis.

intervention.description: MC-group will undergo ultrasonic dissection assisted minilaparotomy cholecystectomy ans patients in the LC-grout will undergo laparoscopic cholecystectomy

clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of Ultrasonic Dissection Assisted Minilaparotomy Cholecystectomy Versus Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy; a Randomised Two-center Study.

oversight_info.authority: Finland: Research Ethics Committee, Hospital District of Northern Savo

primary_outcome.description: Post operative pain, wound infections, bile leak, mean length of sick leave days, use of analgesics the success of day-surgery

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Operative time, time at the operation theatre, bleeding, length of skin incision

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
